alert.note: Alert for Los Angeles (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued February 24 at 10:23PM PST until February 25 at 5:00AM PST by NWS Oxnard
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 415 AM PST SATURDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southwest California, including the following county, Los Angeles. * WHEN...Until 415 AM PST. * IMPACTS...Heavy rainfall will cause widespread ponding of water on area roadways and flooding of low lying areas and intersections. There will be significant overflowing of poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1016 PM PST, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated additional heavy rain moving into the advisory area. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have already fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in continued flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Los Angeles, Long Beach, Torrance, Inglewood, Redondo Beach, Hermosa Beach, Rancho Palos Verdes, Manhattan Beach, Culver City, Venice, Santa Monica, Whittier, Carson, Port of Los Angeles, Rolling Hills and Marina Del Rey. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: The rain will likely trigger minor rock falls, and flooding capable of localized damage, especially in steep terrain. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
